meanings.definition: A highly unpleasant or unhealthy smell or vapor.
meanings.sent1: The miasma from the garbage dump made me cover my nose.
meanings.sent2: The swamp was filled with a thick miasma that made it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent3: The miasma in the old fridge was so bad, it seemed to have a personality of its own.
meanings.sent4: As the miasma of fear spread through the town, people became more cautious.
meanings.sent5: The miasma of decay hung in the air, a reminder of the passage of time.

meanings.definition: A dangerous, foreboding, or oppressive atmosphere or influence.
meanings.sent1: The miasma of suspicion surrounded the accused man.
meanings.sent2: The political unrest created a miasma of uncertainty in the country.
meanings.sent3: The miasma of tension at the family dinner was finally broken by a joke.
meanings.sent4: She felt trapped in a miasma of despair, unable to see a way out.
meanings.sent5: The miasma of secrets in the small town was finally revealed during the trial.
